Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector. Rhemenses is the last name of a human character.
Name of a unique world map sector.
A header name of a task.
You can win this map by finding the remnants of the old Es'Teq religion.[br/][br/]Es'Teq found: {INT_0}/{INT_1}
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

The silver sparrow has landed and built its new nest. We scanned this area from orbit: there are plenty of ruins to comb through. Finding the Es’Teq within all this rubble will be like looking for a needle in a haystack.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

This is where you are at fault, my friend. When the Es’Teq religion was banned and my brothers and sisters went into hiding, we did not abandon our sanctuaries to later be stumbled upon by some lowly looters. Moving rocks is not going to do us any good without the insight of a true believer.

Breaking the Es’Teq code is like solving a puzzle where the different pieces are revelations and the strings connecting them the memories of the right people from the right era. I carry the aspect of Ran Do’Lar in my mind and his intuition is telling me the next sign is close.

You speak in riddles wrapped in thick layers of mystery. But we have been through too much hardship together to doubt your judgment in this moment of truth. Go and follow the path that is laid out before you while I wait for my mother and the rest of House Faron to join us down here on the surface.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Bring Hatyl Es'Ran to the place from his vision and let him commune with the Es'Teq artifact.
Let Hatyl Es'Ran commune with the Es'Teq artifact.

I recognize these patterns from the memories of my Es’Teq symbiont. The hand that takes is the hand that gives. I can trace the echoing Essence to its fountain, but it has dried out, lost its sustenance and function. By imbuing it with the Essence I collected during our journeys, I should be able to return it its purpose...

Passive scans conclusive: formula-E detected. Hibernation mode interrupted.[br/][br/]Updating pending orders… connection failed. Re-employing fallback protocols… Formula-E must be eradicated. Targets acquired. Termination in progress.
Story message. Speaker: RPR Stalker (genderless robot)
The communion seems to have attracted enemies. It looks like those killer robots were waiting for someone to activate the Es'Teq artifact.
Hatyl! Are you alright?[br/][br/]What in the eight gilded dynasties were those things?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Liquidators from the second era! These robots are merciless killing machines. We presumed them lost in the dusts of time, but alas it looks like the scourge of the Es’Teq is still lingering on this world.

Then let us make sure to be better prepared the next time we face them. Still the question remains how they found us so quickly. Could it have something to do with this Essence technology you’ve been using?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Unfortunately, we were never able to fully understand the nature of the RPR robots. But it is true that the harvest of Essence can reap unexpected consequences. You may have already noticed the blight spread over Obolus-5, turning much of its surface into batches of badlands and cold barrens. I suspect this is a symptom of the planet slowly being drained of its Essence.

When I communed with the Es’Teq artifact, I could trace the Essence through the unfolding land until I found a point of culmination where all the ley lines converged: a crypt-like structure hidden somewhere below Obolus-5’s surface. Sadly, my inner eye could not unravel its location, leaving us with another mystery.

Speaking of mysteries: our database lists a number of religious sects centering their faith on Obolus-5 during Star Union days. I wouldn’t be surprised if some of their 'holy relics' turned out to be Es’Teq artifacts. Checking their cult sites could be a worthwhile endeavor.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

There is an Es'Teq crypt hidden on Obolus-5. This is precisely what Hatyl Es'Ran had been looking for. You will need to learn of its exact location.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: you can unlock more routes to completing this quest by exploring Obolus-5 and interacting with present factions.)[/recommendedcol]
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

Another Syndicate out to plunder the treasures of the past? I must say, your kind hasn’t changed one bit. Stay out of my way and I may consider you insignificant enough to spare your pitiful existence.

Can this be true? Archpriestess Ebra – you honor us with your presence. Does this mean the signs have been interpreted correctly? The white raven has made its sacrifice and the great snake has retreated from the cosmic tree.

I did not realize there was a Precursor on this planet. You should be careful whose company you choose, brother.[br/][br/]What you say is not without wisdom. However, the time for Regenesis has not yet come. We owe my awakening to an unlikely admirer.

Archpriestess, if that is so and Regenesis must wait, should we not avoid any risks and escort you back to one of our sanctuaries? I could offer my humble assistance. There is good reason to believe that one of our Arks is here on Obolus-5.

Your words are worthy of a Precursor, and I will take you up on them eventually. However, there are some things that first require my attention. For now, continue fulfilling your prophecy, Ran Do’Lar. Do not touch the Ark until I reach out to you again.
Prophecies, Precursors, Regenesis - I think you owe me some explanations, Hatyl. If this was indeed one of the Es’Teq, she did not seem very pleased to meet me.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
The Syndicate houses of old did not make many friends among the followers of our faith. But Archrpiestess Ebra is a wise woman. She will judge you fairly once you show her your good intentions.

Judge me fairly? I did not come to Obolus-5 to listen to another verdict. This Archpriestess of yours may have been a saint once, but now her aspect is trapped within the twisted body of an Assembly. I do not trust her and neither should you.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Then don’t be surprised when others treat you with the same kind of prejudice. Life is an endless struggle of misconceptions. I can draw on the shared dreams of many Kir’Ko generations and the lifelong memories of a human symbiont, and I have yet to see the day when any universal truth isn’t defied by reality.
Ally Ebra Queztal to uncover the location of the Es'Teq crypt.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Ran Do’Lar… your time has come.[br/][br/]Entropy awaits!
Story message: Speaker: "Es'Teq Siphoner" (Es'Teq human, male)
I feel that my strength is dwindling… {STR_LeaderFirstName}, my friend, flee if you can!
Eliminate the cultists attacking Hatyl Es'Ran or escort your friend into safety!
(In the heat of the battle, just as things start looking grim for him, you see Hatyl Es’Ran disappearing in a flicker of teal lightning.)
Story message. Has no speaker. (Second person narration.)

By Ro’Qwer’Zs horn and tail, this was close! I had to use up all the Essence I had gathered to reach into the Void and escape through the folded space-time. Unfortunately, my stunt also depleted all our Cosmite reserves.
I’m glad to see you’re still in one piece. Cosmite can be mined again. New friends, however, do not simply fall from the sky.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Now that we are all safe again, we need to talk, Hatyl. I recognized the markings on the attackers. They were using the same Essence technology you wield. Are these the Es’Teq 'friends' that were supposed to bring us redemption?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

It is worrisome indeed that my brothers are awake and would so openly turn against me. As Precursor, I am a herald of the Es’Teq prophecy. While I compile my litany, all believers should continue to sleep inside our sanctuaries. Archpriestess Ebra might know more…

…except that she won’t tell us. I didn’t want to bring this up without further proof, but I sent some of our most capable agents to keep an eye on your Archpriestess, and it looks like she already has been – quite literally – assembling her own host of Es’Teq reawakened.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
The rise of a Heritor before Regenesis? Then it is true, and Archpriestess Ebra is no longer walking the path the prophecies laid down before us.

Whatever her plans are, it is quite clear that she doesn’t want us to find the Crypt. What’s more, I wouldn’t be surprised if she already found it herself. Going through her may not be pretty, but it could still be the most effective way to reach our goals.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Whatever her plans are, it is quite clear that she doesn’t want us to find what’s inside the Crypt. Going through her may not be pretty, but it could still be the most effective way to reach our goals.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
While I abhor the thought of violence within our faith, I cannot ignore the danger Ebra Queztal might pose for all Es’Teq. If stopping her is the price for Regenesis, then so be it!
Defeat Ebra Queztal to uncover the location of the Es'Teq crypt.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

Treason committed by a Syndicate? How original… You were never worthy of becoming joined. Now my scavengers will feast on your body and soul.[br/][br/]Ran Do’Lar, it is time to return to your fellow Es’Teq.
I am sorry, Archpriestess Ebra, but my place is with my friend {STR_LeaderName}. You should not have sent our brothers after me. They deserved to see Regenesis.
You are exceeding your competences, Precursor! I do what must be done to protect our prophecy. Revoke your accusations now, and the Conclave will still consider granting you absolution.
There is no absolution needed for the innocent. I have learned from my Kir’Ko host that tyranny can disguise itself in many forms. There won’t be a theocracy with Archpriestess Ebra at its reins.

Then your Essence is ours for the taking. Ran Do’Lar, you are hereby judged and found guilty of heresy of the gravest kind, proclaimed as such by Ebra Queztal, only present representative of the Es’Teq Conclave.[br/][br/]Entropy awaits!
Surrender, Ebra Queztal of the Assembly! We have you cornered, with our guns ready and aimed at your position.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Your primitive weapons cannot stop me! You think this is the only body I have at my disposal? With their cloning techniques and organ harvest, the Assembly are the perfect medium to bring forth the restoration of our divine order. My ascension is… inevitable!

I don’t know if there was any merit to her bragging, but at least this incarnation of Ebra Queztal is dealt with! Now let’s take a look around…[br/][br/]According to these logs the Archpriestess had been quite busy before she got to Obolus-5. More than a dozen visited worlds and a list of names, most of them crossed out.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

I recognize these names: Erees Caloque, Rhesha Ometi, Tlalo Potchilim… they were all Precursors of this era. If Archpriestess Ebra killed them, she clearly knew they would interpret the signs like I did… and that the time for Regenesis had come.
And there is more: it seems Ebra Queztal found the Es’Teq Crypt on Obolus-5 long before we arrived. Likely she only avoided entering it to not risk making us aware of its location.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

You found the entrance to the Es'Teq crypt. Enter and claim the reward for your efforts.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: you need a hero present at an anomalous site such as this to progress through its events.)[/recommendedcol]
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
There it is, the treasured artifact of the Es’Teq, shimmering like an obsidian obelisk. Tell me, Hatyl, what it is that we will find when we open it?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Redemption. A new life. Power. The responsibilities lying ahead will be a test of character and faith. I will be at your side if you need me during this new journey, my friend.
Thank you, Hatyl. As the new head of House Faron, I say it is time to stop contemplating the past and start adding a fresh chapter to our family chronicles.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Break the seal on the Regenesis Ark to access what's inside.
Break the seal on the Regenesis Ark to access what's inside.
Rise, brothers, rise! Regenesis is at its dawn.[br/][br/]Let us greet the new Prophet that has come before the divine tribunal of our High Lord!
Story message. Speaker: "Es'Teq Minds" (group of Es'Teq, various genders)

The contrast, the colors - I feel as though I could glimpse beyond the fabric of reality. My memories and past, all seem to have entered a new state of flux.[br/][br/]The flame of revelation, it burns away all sin. No, no... why won’t it stop?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Story message. Speaker: "Xito Rhemenses" (Es'Teq human, male)

Silver sparrow calling the crow’s nest. We made it down without complications and are setting up operations. So far, no hostiles detected. What’s the status up there? Are the landing preparations progressing according to plan?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

So, your bug friend didn’t manage to get everybody killed yet? What a relief… Planetfall will proceed as scheduled, as had to be expected with someone capable in command. But for the last time, {STR_LeaderFirstName}, stop using your childish code names! I am to be addressed as Lady Ista of House Faron. That is even ignoring the eighteen honorary titles I inherited as head of our family...
Story message. Speaker: "Ista of House Faron" (Syndicate, female)

You mean the titles that we were stripped of when we lost all property and privilege? If it wasn’t for my ‘bug friend’ you would likely still be eking out your existence as a more decadent pleasure girl.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Guard your tongue, son! You are underestimating the influence I already had over Lord Ardelli. If you and your little rebellion hadn’t intervened, I would have had him wrapped around my little finger soon enough. But speak no more! It is time for the Lady of House Faron to withdraw and prepare her arrival.

Guard your tongue, daughter! You are underestimating the influence I already had over Lord Ardelli. If you and your little rebellion hadn’t intervened, I would have had him wrapped around my little finger soon enough. But speak no more! It is time for the Lady of House Faron to withdraw and prepare her arrival.
Story message. Speaker: "Ista of House Faron" (Syndicate, female)
Wait for the second mothership to land on Obolus-5.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
The time has come. They should be ready to descend.[br/][br/]What is the situation, mother? Will Lady Ista of House Faron bless this planet with her presence?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Why do I detect a slight note of cynicism in your voice? I hope you won’t continue to disappoint me with lapses of this kind…[br/][br/]The ship is ready for planetfall. We will be going down in 3… 2… 1…
Story message. Speaker: "Ista of House Faron" (Syndicate, female)
(The transmission is suddenly cut. All you can still hear are static noises.)
Story message. Has no speaker. (Second person narration.)
Mother? What happened? Respond, for the love of your eighteen titles![br/][br/]Nothing, damn it! We need to quickly gather a rescue party and check the landing site.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Check the landing site of the second ship.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

The ‘Faron-2’! They smashed into the dunes of Obolus-5 like a humming bird into a Zenith barge. This shouldn’t have happened – my mother was the last one who knew the truth about our family’s downfall. With her gone, I may never be able to rightfully redeem the name of our house.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Chief {STR_LeaderFirstName}, do not falter! The Faron-2 was a sturdy ship. Our scans are showing that it’s still partially intact. There may yet be hope for our companions.
Your optimism is inspiring, brother. And you are right: we wouldn’t be standing here, if we had been afraid of any odds in the past. Let’s pack up and search the wreck for survivors!
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Check the wreck of the Faron-2 for survivors and find out why it crash landed.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: you need a hero present at a anomalous site such as this to progress through its events.)[/recommendedcol]
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
The second ship of House Faron made a violent crash-landing deep into Obolus-5's surface. At this point it is unclear how the tragedy occurred or if anybody survived the impact.

Your men have worked their way down the rocks and excavated the rear of the Faron-2. This part of the ship looks like it’s still mostly in one piece, at least from the outside. The force of the impact must have mainly affected the front that’s buried deeper underground. After some examination of the hull, your troops find a broken hatch and enter the ship’s cargo bay.

The crates and containers inside the cargo-bay lie scattered in destructive chaos. Next to the blocked door is a leaking PsiTec modulator engine. From the top, you can hear the sleek humming of the ventilation system.
Pile up the crates and leave through the ventilation shafts.
An anomalous site action while being performed.
Shoot the engine to blast the door open.
An anomalous site action while being performed.
Repair the modulator and use it to interface with the door.
An anomalous site action while being performed.

It took some time to maneuver through the ventilation system, but at least the narrow self-contained shafts closed you off from any nasty surprises. Slowly but steadily, your troops have made their way to the ship’s command center.

Your troops clearly know their weapon tech: one precise shot and the modulator engine goes off in a controlled blast, opening up a path deeper into the ship. Morale starts to sink however, as you start finding your dead companions. So far it doesn’t seem like anybody survived the impact.

The shot misses, frying the navigation panel on the wall behind. It also seems to have triggered the ship’s alarm system, as moments later the door is opened by a group of recently-acquired security robots.

Shooting your own property is never pleasant, but at least now the path deeper into the ship is clear. Morale starts to sink, however, as you start finding your dead companions. So far it doesn’t seem like anybody survived the impact.
A group of security robots you had recently acquired for the Faron-2 is still patrolling its cargo bay, ready to attack any intruders. Naturally, they no longer recognize any of your clearance codes.

After enough tinkering with the modulator engine, it can be used to interface with the door to open it. Your troops keep the delicate device as they make their way deeper into the ship. Morale starts to sink, however, as you start finding your dead companions. So far it doesn’t seem like anybody survived the impact.

The ship’s former command center is not a pretty sight. In between all the sheared metal and engines, the unrecognizable remains of your house members are spread. There was never any real chance to save them.[br/][br/]Unless… One of your void engineers notices that the main phase drive reactor is still partially intact. There are theories that by overcharging such a reactor while it is being pushed into another dimension, a feedback-loop with the past can be created, altering the existing timeline…
Let go of the past and build a memorial.
An anomalous site action while being performed.
Overcharge the phase drive reactor and disrupt the timeline.
An anomalous site action while being performed.

With your mother’s death, not just her eighteen honorary titles but the burden of an entire house’s history has passed on to you. While you are placing the flowers on the memorial grave of the Faron-2 crew, you are wondering if your family’s redemption is a worthy goal, when it is really your own actions that you should be judged by.

The phase drive reactor is screeching in repeating sounds of distortion while it is slowly getting sucked into the Void. For a moment, reality starts to shift as the reactor overcharges with blue lightning: destroyed conduits become whole again, broken bodies rematerialize and start moving in reverse. But then another flash of lightning strikes, and the entire crash scene rewinds. You see everybody die a second time, except now their split echoes keep lingering on next to their smashed remains. And they are opening fire!

The destabilized phase drive reactor vanishes into the Void anomaly, which is now consuming all that is left of the Faron-2. The experience with the phase echoes has given you new insights into Voidtech, but considering what happened, this seems like a small consolation.
The ship’s command center is guarded by echoes of the departed Faron-2 crew. They don’t seem eager to interact with any of their former friends and family.
{STR_LeaderFirstName}, what have you done? Could you not leave us in peace?
Story message. Speaker: "Ista of House Faron" (Syndicate, female)
Lady Ista… mother… I had to do everything in my power to save you. Our bloodline mustn’t end like this![br/][br/]What happened? Why did the Faron-2 crash?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Ignorant child! Our house ceased to exist more than three decades ago. The betrayal cost us everything except our pride. I deserved to die before the last bit of nobility had vanished from our family.
Story message. Speaker: "Ista of House Faron" (Syndicate, female)
I don’t understand… We were supposed to lay open the injustice that was brought upon us, restore honor to the name of House Faron.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Honor? Don’t you dare use that word you have so little knowledge of! Learning that my son had broken his Indentured contract and acted up as leader of a silly slave rebellion... there could have been no greater shame. Or so I thought, until I saw you with that Kir’Ko – the last descendant of House Faron had become the servant of a bug!

Honor? Don’t you dare use that word you have so little knowledge of! Learning that my daughter had broken her Indentured contract and acted up as leader of a silly slave rebellion... there could have been no greater shame. Or so I thought, until I saw you with that Kir’Ko – the last descendant of House Faron had become the servant of a bug!
Story message. Speaker: "Ista of House Faron" (Syndicate, female)
I crash-landed this ship onto Obolus-5’s surface! It is better for the Lady of House Faron to perish than to witness the last decline of her kin. Goodbye, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. The Abyss awaits me…
Story message. Speaker: "Ista of House Faron" (Syndicate, female)
The Crypt: Sects of the Star Union
To uncover the location of the Heritor crypt, you should pay the various cult sites on Obolus-5 a visit and search their archives.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Find and enter the temple of the Psynumbra sect on Obolus-5.
Search Chapel of Abyssal Edgelords [firecol](Consumes Unit!)[/firecol]
Go inside the Chapel and search for any hints on the Es'Teq and their Essense technology.
One of the Es'Teq artifacts ended up inside the motorcycle of Empris Lox, a crazy Assembly and Psynumbra cultist. Defeat Empris Lox to recover what he calls the "soul-reaper engine".
(It looked like the back door would be an easy way in, but as you enter the first chamber, a trap is set off, consuming one of your men in a purple flash of light.)
Story message. Has no speaker. (Second person narration.)
Visitors! Come and embrace the darkness! Beyond the Veil, your suffering will be rewarded.
An Assembly worshipping the powers of evil? Why am I not surprised…
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

False! I was a priest of the Abyssal Edgelords long before the masters of metal and flesh descended from the skies. While others fled the Reassembly, I was the first to happily line up for my body upgrade. Finally, I have the right appearance to ride my soul-reaper bike in style!
Is it my imagination, or is this thing you’re driving powered by Essence technology?[br/][br/]I don’t suppose there is a nice way to convince you to leave the engine of your bike to us, Empris Lox?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
My bike’s engine is the most metal thing the Abyssal Edgelords ever dug up. It is fueled by the screaming souls of the living. You can have it… run over your dead bodies, haha!
Urgh, you should have told me you’re serious. Here, take the damn engine! I’ll make my spacer-buds dig me up a new one!
Good. Now that this is dealt with… what’s your opinion on our newest acquisition, Hatyl?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Find and enter the temple of the Celestian sect on Obolus-5.
Search Shrine of the Smiling Dove
Go inside the Shrine and search for any hints on the Es'Teq and their Essense technology.

More lost souls have ventured the winding road to the Celestian shrines in need of guidance. I sense determination and a strong will, but also shame and the poisoned seed of vengeance from the shadows of a past injustice.[br/][br/]{STR_LeaderName}, what is it that you seek?

We came to Obolus-5 looking for the remnants of an ancient dynasty. There is reason to believe that one of their artifacts may be located inside your sanctuary. Maybe you can help us on our search? The object we are after would likely be emitting some teal glow when activated.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

It would also make everything wither and drain the life force from anyone unfortunate enough to touch its cursed coat. I know very well which artifact you are talking about. Its evil has been safeguarded by my order for a long time after all attempts to root out its corruption failed. You must not have it.

What if I assured you, I have no intention of using the artifact? It is merely a puzzle piece needed on our journey, a compass if you will. My friend may even find a way to destroy it after some observation.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

A path revealed by evil can only lead to more evil. Even the enlightened must be wary to walk in such darkness. If you truly seek to be allowed into the forbidden, you must first pass the Celestian judgment. Visit our gardens to clear your mind of sorrow. Return to me when you are ready.
Pass some time in the gardens of the Shrine of the Smiling Dove and meditate. When you are ready, return to Laila Dama to complete the Celestian Trial.
Sit down in the Celestian garden to meditate.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
You are in a desert. You see a vulture circling over a lifeless body still leaning with the back against a well. The well has a sign attached to it.[br/][br/]What does the sign say?
“Everyone who drinks this water will become a vulture.”

In the kat-kit pub there are three black dogs playing poker. A pinto is spilling his drink over two grey geese while the white waiter goat has to listen to the vulgarities of a group of rose bachelor piglets.
What is the color of the cat?
There is no cat in this story.
A fortune teller lets you glimpse into his crystal bowl to learn about the future.[br/][br/]What do you see?
I think I’ve had enough meditation for this lifetime. Can the trial finally begin?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
The trial started the moment we first met, {STR_LeaderName}. But you need not worry, for the answers you gave have dispersed my initial doubts. You are allowed to take the forbidden artifact.

The trial started the moment we first met, {STR_LeaderName}. While some of your intentions may be noble, your words are still misguided and confused.[br/][br/]I have created a reflection of your inner struggle. Face those images from your mind and you can overcome your doubts.
Defeat the reflections of your inner turmoil to still complete the Celestian trial.
Walk with the stars, {STR_LeaderName}. You have passed the trial and are allowed to take the forbidden artifact.
Thank you, Laila Dama of the Celestian order. I will treat it with great care and caution.[br/][br/]Hatyl, did you get the artifact? Please tell me all this was worth the effort!
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Thank you, Laila Dama of the Celestian order. I will treat the cursed item with great care and caution.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

It is looking good. Even though diverted from its intended use, this artifact is clearly Es’Teq work. I can connect to the Essence that passed through it over the centuries, but the trail is too faint to follow. We will need to collect more Es’Teq items.

We are on the right path. My brothers would turn over in their crypts if they saw the heretical use of our sacred technology, but at least we are getting closer. The Essence trail is slowly taking shape. Just one more item…

With all three items to commune with, the Essence trail is forming before my inner eye. I can follow it all the way through the centuries back to its source…[br/][br/]Yes…yes! This must be where the Heritor Crypt lies hidden!
Find and enter the Temple of the Divine Investments faith on Obolus-5.
Go inside the Temple and search for any hints on the Es'Teq and their Essense technology.

Come in, step inside! The booze is still sparkling and the dice and dimes keep rolling! There are fortunes to be made by every believer who dares to give their fate a spin in our illustrious Temple of Bling-Jack 90k!
Using a religion as a disguise for running another casino chain? I have to say, the Union must have been more corrupt than I ever gave it credit for.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Why worship an invisible god with no business in reality, when you can believe in the one tangible power that made entire empires rise and fall? Why dismiss a faith for being forthright and honest, when you could also play to win that… Cash Cow Converter 90k! It turns the Essence of everything it touches into pure energy – if needed even you mother-in-law!

Why worship an invisible god with no business in reality, when you can believe in the one tangible power that made entire empires rise and fall? Why dismiss a faith for being forthright and honest, when you could also play to win that… Cash Cow Converter 90k! It turns the Essence of everything it touches into pure energy – if needed even you father-in-law!
Did you just say ‘Essence’? You’ve got me interested. What do I need to do to win that thing?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Excellent! I figured you’d be a man who can appreciate a good gamble.[br/][br/]It’s rather simple really. All you need to do is beat the nine-armed bandit. You will find it’s quite an upgrade to the old octo-bandit.

Excellent! I figured you’d be a woman who can appreciate a good gamble.[br/][br/]It’s rather simple really. All you need to do is beat the nine-armed bandit. You will find it’s quite an upgrade to the old octo-bandit.
Gamble with the nine-armed bandit in the Temple of Bling-Jack 90k until you win the grand jackpot - which happens to be an Es'Teq artifact called the "Cash Cow Converter 90k".
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

Welcome, follower of the Divine Investments faith, to your new game of Bling-Jack 90k! Pull the levers and receive your heavenly prize! The more you bet the higher the chances! Today’s jackpot is at 6 Carminias, 2 Tholians and 1 Mora.
Story message. Speaker: "NAB" (short for nine-armed bandit, a gambling machine)
The RNG god is not smiling on you today.[br/][br/]You’ve gained 1[energy/]. Return for more.
Story message. Speaker: "NAB" (short for nine-armed bandit, a gambling machine)
Not enough [energy/][energy/][energy/]! Come back when you’ve been blessed with new fortune!
Story message. Speaker: "NAB" (short for nine-armed bandit, a gambling machine)
JACKPOT!!! Praise the RNG god and praise the Divine Investments Church![br/][br/]Contact your local Cash Cleric to claim the rewards.
Story message. Speaker: "NAB" (short for nine-armed bandit, a gambling machine)

You think I’m the local Cash Cleric? It says so on my tag? Uh, of course. Um, congratulations then. You’ve unexpectedly won the grand prize: the Cash Cow Converter 90k! This is totally not ruining my establishment or anything… You surely want to gamble for more, don’t you? Don’t you?!
Absolutely not. You shouldn’t have allowed your slot machines to evolve this far.[br/][br/]Now on to the artifact, Hatyl…
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Absolutely not. You simply shouldn’t have allowed your slot machines to evolve this far.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Chief {STR_LeaderFirstName}, the priests from the different cults you visited are asking to be taken on board and leave Obolus-5 along with us. Should we allow them to join?
Hm, given their contrasting beliefs, there would sooner or later be conflict. It would be unwise of us to accept all of them into our ranks. Considering our options, I’d say we best take along…
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Kss kss - more bleeders have come to Obolus-5 to feel the grip of the Abyss and Chax Uz’Kol’s revenge! The one of metal and flesh did right to guide the Kir’Ko Ula to this place.[br/][br/]But what do I spot here? Our beloved dream reader Hatyl Ur’Uk, once again shackled by the Syndicate? Grzz kl’tk rsh’nrr! The sack-bleeders must pay!
Hox’Krit’Pat, brother! I have received no harm from the ones you greet with curses. {STR_LeaderName} is not your enemy.

Oh, brother! Like you I once trusted the words of the one called Eva Montinga. Until the metal-grafters revealed to me her crimes against our ancestors. That’s when I learned there are no trustworthy sack-bleeders. They taught our race the meaning of agony. Now the Kir’Ko Ula feed them to the Abyss.

What do you advise me to do, my friend? I would hate to cause your people any harm, but a confrontation with Chax Uz’Kol’s colony may be inevitable.[br/][br/]Also, I didn’t realize you had a separate Kir’Ko name.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

It is not uncommon for a host to adopt a part of his symbionts name after being joined. Hatyl Ur’Uk is what I was called in the past. Hatyl Es’Ran is my Heritor name.[br/][br/]Chax Uz’Kol has chosen the darkest path. To reach him, I will have to go to the place where no light can dwell.
Bring Hatyl to the Psynumbra Chapel
Hatyl Es'Ran wants to reach Chax Uz'Kol on a spirtitual level. To this end, he needs to travel to the dangerous remnants of the Psynumbra.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
This place is old and yet an infant next to the monuments of the Es’Teq. It has seen much hatred and suffering, nurturing an evil that should have never been allowed to enter this world.
Ancestral agony, suffering and vengeance… Hatyl Ur’Uk, the sack-bleeders will feast on your soul!
Story message: Speaker: "Sinister Voice" (incorporeal, ethereal being, same gender as Marlok Tenor, so potentially either male or female)
Back off, foul spawn! Your kind has no influence in this reality!

We were called here… invited by the ones seeking comfort – and power. They always hunger for more. Look and see the true nature of {STR_LeaderName}! The sack-bleeder is treacherous. Leave him to us… and we leave Obolus-5!
Story message: Speaker: "Sinister Voice" (incorporeal, ethereal being, same gender as Marlok Tenor, so potentially either male or female)
Ignore the Image and take the Psi-Stone
Your words are poison, but no thrax could veil your ill intentions. I will cast you back into the Abyss you came from!
Your illusions cannot fool me. I did not come to face you, Lohikarne. The Psi-Stone of Malice, spreader of your corruption, is what I came for.
Then you have chosen death, old fool.[br/][br/]Lohikarne will not be denied his prize!
Story message: Speaker: "Sinister Voice" (incorporeal, ethereal being, male)
Kill the Shadow Image that has been trying to turn Hatyl Es'Ran against you.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Lohikarne has manifested an echo of itself to protect the Psi-Stone of Malice. Destroy the echo and take the Psi-Stone!
The suffering… the agony![br/][br/]The Abyss will swallow you, Hatyl Es’Ran… one day!
Story message: Speaker: "Sinister Voice" (incorporeal, ethereal being, male)

By Ro’Qwer’Zs horn and tail! I could follow your death struggle with the sack-bleeder through the whispers of the Void. It is exhilarating to see Hatyl Ur’Uk swarm with his people again! Blessed like this, the Kir’Ko Ula will strike their enemy with sharpened claws and minds!

You misunderstand, brother. I was not fighting {STR_LeaderName}, but a shadow image from the Abyss, mimicking my human friend.[br/][br/]Alas, it’s too late… Chax Uz’Kol will only see what he prefers to see. I failed because I only paid attention to the clearest path.
The suffering… the agony![br/][br/]The Abyss will swallow you, Hatyl Es’Ran… one day!
Story message: Speaker: "Sinister Voice" (incorporeal, ethereal being, male)

The Echo of Lohirkarne is retreating, the path to the Psi-Stone of Malice clear.[br/][br/]Swarm Herald Chax Uz’Kol, in these claws I hold the true source of our people’s continued agony. While we preserve and nurture the suffering within our ancestral dreams and kindle our hatred with forbidden artifacts, the scars from the past will never heal.

How can you say that the swarm should not remember, when it is all that is left of our Hive since the unspeakable act that initiated the Zok’Shiar? If we forget the suffering of our ancestors, we will return to suffer their fate.

We can honor our forefathers without constantly reliving the horrors they had to endure. The dreams are an important part of our heritage, but we should not allow them to define who we are. Each dream is interpreted and perceived in a different way. I urge you to visit the Swarm Herald of the Kir’Ko Terym. Listen to his journey and you’ll find that there is another path.

I see now that your mind is still in unity with the swarm. When the famous Dream Reader of my people asks me to consult the Swarm Herald that returned us to our home world Xa’Kir’Ko, I will not refuse to show some good faith. Still, you must in turn allow the Kir’Ko Ula to stay until your safety on Obolus-5 is ensured.

This is General Jack Gelder of the Egalitarian League of Planets. Listen up, members of House Nydar, 'cause I’m only gonna say this once: Drop your weapons, and there won’t be any need for a shootout. We’ve tracked you all to Obolus-5. There is nowhere left to run.

House Nydar? It seems you’ve followed the wrong track, General. As some future advice, you can best recognize a Syndicate by his robes. House Nydar usually wear red satin with an embroidered Sentinel as their insignia.[br/][br/]My lot on the other hand… well, as you can see, we like to be colorful.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Your talk about fashion doesn’t interest me, kid. As far as I’m concerned, a Syndicate dressed in any color is not to be trusted.[br/][br/]But... aren’t you the leader of that Minerva-2 slave rebellion? In that case I’ll say well met. It was about damn time you drudges started to fight back!
An easy thing to say when you have no collar choking on your neck, isn’t it? Either way, I’ll return the good regards, General. I did not realize the tale of our little mutiny had traveled this far.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

It surely has. In times where the ELOP Confederation is negotiating with the Syndicate Houses, urging them to abolish their feudal practices, there is great interest in any favorable voices for our cause from within the Syndicate. Once my mission to deal with House Nydar is over, I could take you to Mora Secundis. First Minister Tholian likes to have a word with you.

A flattering offer, but I’m afraid your First Minister will have to wait. I can’t leave my squadron without leadership while we are still the declared enemy of half the Syndicate Houses. As a Vanguard officer I’m sure you’ll understand.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Very well, {STR_LeaderName}. We’ll check on your status later on. But remember: we won’t be far off, so if you get into trouble out there, just give a shout!

Would you look at that: if it isn’t the rebellious Indentured from Minerva-2! House Faron truly has become a pitiful disgrace to all Syndicate. First the attempt to loot the Aureate Treasury, and now this…

My grandfather was a great man. As warden of the Aureate Treasury he enjoyed the trust of the Ruling Seven, and had no reason to risk the position of our house. It should have been obvious that he was framed for someone else’s crime.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

You haven’t seen the riches of the Aureate Treasury, have you? Your grandfather wasn’t the first one to yield to its temptation, though he may have come closest to getting away with it. Luckily, we can soon conclude the last chapter of your house’s sorry tale. The bounty on your head will be a convenient way to cover our expenses on Obolus-5.
Nyla Abaz has made it very clear that she wants to claim the bounty on your head for starting a Syndicate slave rebellion. In order to be left in peace, you will need to crush her.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

How is this possible? You lowly slaves should have bowed before my Overseers, polished the chairs of my Subjugators![br/][br/]You can take my life, but you cannot take my nobility. We will never surrender to the plebs!

Who said anything about taking your life? You have hands to work like anybody else. Our community is small. We don’t have the luxury to execute everyone we disagree with.[br/][br/]Appreciate this new life we have to offer, or throw it away. It’s up to you.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
We have a code red situation down here, I repeat, code red! Colonel Jiang, this would be a good moment to test your new atmospheric thrusters. Take us out of here, NOW!
Poison, blight, death! Grzz kl’tk rsh’nrr! I curse all sack-bleeders with my last breath. Avenge me, my brothers! The Abyss shall devour them all…
All faithful rejoice, for Creator sends us his emissary! With the return of the Es’Teq our curse will be lifted. Our endurance and suffering will finally be rewarded!
Storye message. Speaker: "Golem" (Forgotten, can be any gender)

The obsidian guardians… I recognize the ornate husks from my symbiont’s memories. This isn’t good. Those that cannot see Regenesis should never return to the waking world. Why did you leave your post in the eternal vaults, guardian?

We… don’t remember. Since the curse inflicted us, we are rotting away, our Essence leaking into the fangs of Entropy. There was nothing left in the underworld to consume. Here, on the surface, we can continue to fulfill Creator’s commandments.
Storye message. Speaker: "Golem" (Forgotten, can be any gender)

You are one of the Es’Teq, your Essence still preserved in the holy image of Creator. You must lift our curse, end the corruption that is tormenting us. Take one of our Desolate brothers. Let him feast on the holy sites. Speak the incantations and purify him through the Essence he consumes.
Storye message. Speaker: "Golem" (Forgotten, can be any gender)
Take the Forgotten to the holy sites of the Es'Teq and let them consume new, purified Essence to cure their sickness.
Set free the Essence stored in the holy Es'Teq site to let it be consumed by the Forgotten.
We were entombed alive, fulfilling our duty that should only have ended through death or the coming of our Creator. When the Essence started to run dry, we were facing eternal Entropy.
Storye message. Speaker: "Desolate" (Forgotten unit, can be any gender)

There was no escape to the overworld, the only sustenance within reach the subjects of our protection. So, we started to consume our brothers and sisters, feeding on their Essence like leeches on their victim’s blood.
Storye message. Speaker: "Desolate" (Forgotten unit, can be any gender)

But soon it wasn’t enough to take their Essence. The entire body had to be devoured, consumed for every droplet of life force that could prolong our existence. This is when we became cursed, condemned to feed on corpses for eternity. We are the living dead, and we always hunger for more…
Storye message. Speaker: "Desolate" (Forgotten unit, can be any gender)
Stop! Enough, Essence fiend! There is no absolution for the atrocities you committed. Even if I had the means and the knowledge, no Essence should be wasted on the unholy.
You entombed us, abandoned us, left us forgotten. We were doomed even before the curse condemned our existence. And now that Creator sent you, you deny us our salvation?
Storye message. Speaker: "Golem" (Forgotten, can be any gender)

The wretched creature has a point. If the Es’Teq truly played their part in the creation of the Forgotten, you cannot simply leave them to their fate. Isn’t mercy one of the first virtues you tried to teach me?
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

You are right, my friend. In my horror I chose wrath over conciliation. But the corruption of the Forgotten runs deep. I would need the knowledge of the High Es’Teq Lords before I could even start working on a cure. At the moment, there is nothing I can do for them.

I hate to bring it up, Hatyl, but there could be another way of finding the Es’Teq Crypt. In their hunger, the Forgotten have become like tracking dogs when it comes to locating any larger pools of Essence. If we offer them something in return…
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Asking the damned for help in our sacred mission? I am… hesitant to heed this advice, my friend. I need to learn more about the Forgotten, see if their corruption has only twisted their bodies, or if their minds have become rotten as well.

Hatyl is not convinced that learning the location of the Es'Teq Crypt from the Forgotten is a good idea. To change his mind, intensify your diplomatic efforts with the Forgotten to get a better understanding of their nature.

While their fear of death has led the Forgotten to embrace false idols and terrible sin, there are still sparks of decency and good faith left in some of their actions. We can trust them enough to ask about the Crypt.

Yes… there is a sanctuary of the old faithful. We have sensed its precious Essence many times, yet the sacred barriers protecting the Es’Teq denied us all passage. If you venture into their halls, remember the Forgotten and their curse. Creator’s emissary must not fail.
Storye message. Speaker: "Golem" (Forgotten, can be any gender)

With the planet under our control, our troops had the time to systematically search Obolus-5 for the legacy of the Es’Teq. They found the Es’Teq Crypt buried below the sand from which they eventually recovered an Ark.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

With the planet under our control, our troops had the time to systematically search Obolus-5 for the legacy of the Es’Teq. They found a Crypt of Es’Teq origin buried below the sand from which they eventually recovered an Ark.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)

Why, {STR_LeaderName}? Has your prejudice really led you to seek war with the ones that were supposed to bring you redemption? Then it is with great sadness that I have to leave you, my friend. May you return to a path of enlightenment before it is too late.
Without Hatyl to guide us, all hope of claiming the legacy of the Es’Teq is lost. Our rebellion has reached a dead end.
Story message. Speaker: "Marlok Tenor" (Syndicate, can be both male or female)
Name of a casus belli (war reason).
Name of a casus belli (war reason).
